tit.e: The historical museum of Hanazono University
The historical museum of Hanazono University
The historical museum of Hanazono University

sen.j: 花園大学歴史博物館（はなぞのだいがくれきしはくぶつかん）は、京都市中京区にある花園大学が2000年に創設した博物館（博物館相当施設）。
sen.e: The historical museum of Hanazono University was established in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, by the university in 2000.
The historical museum of Hanazono University was established in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, in 2000.
The historical museum of Hanazono University was established in Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, in 2000.

sen.j: 仏教系大学初のユニバーシティー・ミュージアムである。
sen.e: This is the first museum established by a Buddhism-based university.
This is the first museum established by a Buddhism-based university.
This is the first museum established by a Buddhism-based university.

sen.j: 花園大学の調査・研究活動によって蓄積された資料を広く公開し、大学教育だけでなく、市民に開かれた大学の中核施設として、展示活動や教育活動を行っている。
sen.e: Hanazono University has used the museum for exhibitions and educational activities as a core facility that is to be used not only for education in the university but also to make it more open to the public, by making the materials accumulated through its research activities open to the public.

Hanazono University has used the museum for exhibitions and educational activities as a core facility used not only for education, but making the materials accumulated through its research activities open to the public.

Hanazono University has used the museum for exhibitions and educational activities as a core facility used not only for education, but making the materials accumulated through its research activities open to the public.

sen.j: 主に文学部史学科の教員が運営に携わっているが、展示活動等に学生・大学院生を中心としたボランティア・スタッフが参加しているのも特徴のひとつで、学芸員などを目指す学生が実物に触れながら実践的に学ぶことができる場ともなっている。
sen.e: Although the museum is mainly operated by teachers in the history course of the literature department, it is also a feature of the museum that volunteers centered on undergraduate and graduate students participate in activities, for example, for exhibitions, providing the students aiming at becoming curators an opportunity of learning curators' work practically through actually handling collected real artifacts and documents.

Although the museum is mainly operated by history teachers in literature department, volunteers centered on undergraduate and graduate students also participate in activities, like exhibitions, providing students aiming at becoming curators an opportunity of learning practical curators' work through actually handling real artifacts and documents.

Although the museum is mainly operated by history teachers in literature department, volunteers centered on undergraduate and graduate students also participate in activities, like exhibitions, providing students aiming at becoming curators an opportunity of learning practical curators' work through in fact handling real artifacts and documents.

sen.j: 開館時間
sen.e: The hours when the museum is open
The museum is open:
The museum is open:

sen.j: 10時00分～16時00分（土曜日は1400まで）
sen.e: 10: 00 to 16: 00 (until 14: 00 on Saturdays)
10: 00 to 16: 00 (until 14: 00 on Saturdays)
10: 00 to 16: 00 (until 14: 00 on Saturdays)

sen.j: 原則として、大学の開講期間のみの開館。
sen.e: Basically, the museum is open in the peiod when class acitivities in the university are underway.
Basically, the museum is open during class hours.
Basically, the museum is open during class hours.

Facilities

The first exhibition room (for permanent exhibitions)
The first exhibition room (for permanent exhibitions)

sen.j: 展示室は無聖館4階に設置。
sen.e: The exhibition rooms are placed on the fourth floor of Musho-kan Hall.
The exhibition rooms are on the fourth floor of Musho-kan Hall.
The exhibition rooms are on the fourth floor of Musho-kan Hall.

sen.j: 第1展示室には、QRコードと携帯電話とを組み合わせた閲覧支援システム（文学部・史学科・情報歴史学コースの学生が中心になって開発）が設置されている。
sen.e: In the first exhibition room, a system for aiding visitors in enjoying viewing exhibited items, which is made by combining QR codes and cell phones, has been installed (the system has been developed mostly by students and in the information history sub-course in the historical course of the literature department).

In the first exhibition room, there is a system to aid visitors viewing exhibitions, made by combining QR codes and cell phones, has been developed and installed mostly by students from the information history sub-course in of the literature department.

In the first exhibition room, there is a system to aid visitors viewing exhibitions, made by combining QR codes and cell phones, has been developed and installed mostly by students from the information history sub-course in of the literature department.

sen.e: Exhibitions
Exhibitions
Exhibitions

sen.j: 常設展示
sen.e: The permanent exhibitions
Permanent exhibitions
Permanent exhibitions

sen.j: 考古学部門、民俗学部門、美術・禅文化部門、歴史学・典籍部門の4部門に関する収集資料を展示。
sen.e: Materials collected in the four departments of archaeology, ethnology, art and zen-curture, history and documents are exhibited.
Materials collected in the four departments of archaeology, ethnology, art and zen-curture, history and documents are exhibited.
Materials collected in the four departments of archaeology, ethnology, art and zen-culture, history and documents are exhibited.

sen.j: 主なコレクションは以下の通り（コレクションがすべて展示されているわけではないので注意）。
sen.e: Major collected items include the following (note that all of the collectied items are not exhibited):
Major items include the following (note that all of the collectied items are not exhibited):
Major items include the following (note that all of the collected items are not exhibited):

sen.j: 京都市最大の前方後円墳である伏見区桃山町黄金塚2号墳（4世紀末）出土の埴輪群
sen.e: The haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the mounded tombs (kofun)) unearthed from Ogontsuka Nigo-fun Tumulus (the second Ogontsuka tumulus), Momoyama-cho, Fushimi Ward, the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound in Kyoto City.

Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the tomb mounds (kofun) unearthed from Ogontsuka Nigo-fun Tumulus (the second Ogontsuka tumulus), Momoyama-cho, Fushimi Ward, the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound in Kyoto City.

Haniwa (unglazed terra-cotta cylinders and hollow sculptures arranged on and around the tomb mounds [kofun]) unearthed from the second Ogontsuka tumulus (from the end of fourth century), Momoyama-cho, Fushimi Ward, the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound in Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。4世紀末を訳出しました。

sen.j: シャーマンらしき人物の線刻画がある盾型埴輪など
sen.e: They include a shield-type haniwa with a line drawing of a shaman-like human being.
They include a shield-type haniwa with a line drawing of a shaman-like human being.
They include a shield-type haniwa with a line drawing of a shaman-like human being.

sen.j: 俣賀家は石見国の御家人
sen.e: The Mataga family (俣賀家) was the family of a gokenin (a retainer under direct control of a shogun) in Iwami Province.
sen.cmt: 俣賀家→[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: The Mataga family (俣賀家) was a family of a gokenin (a retainer under direct control of a shogun) in Iwami Province.

Planned exhibition in the autumn of fiscal 2007, "Uji dolls: the world of dolls made of tea trees" (October 22 to December 15, 2007)
Planned exhibition in the autumn of fiscal year 2007, 'Uji dolls: the world of dolls made of tea trees' (October 22 to December 15, 2007)
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。"fiscal" -> "fiscal year" に変更しました。

sen.j: 2008年度春期企画展「春日局ゆかりの寺 妙心寺展」（2008年4月2日～6月28日）
sen.e: The planned exhibition in the spring of the fiscal 2008, "Myoshin-ji Temple, a temple related to Ksugano-tsubone (a woman famous as a hoster mother of a shogun in the Edo period)" (April 2 to June 28, 2008)

sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせて"を'に訂正しました。Ksuga no tsuboneとしました。"fiscal" -> "fiscal year" に変更しました。

sen.j: 京都歴史回廊協議会に参加。
